otter_cliffs.name: In the Groove
otter_cliffs.beta: Pull the first ledge, then bear left on good hand and footholds. Step right onto the flake, switch feet and find a high right foot outside the flake then jug haul to the top.

otter_cliffs.name: Wonder Corner
otter_cliffs.beta: Follow corner system up the wall, either moving right onto the face at the crux or find a high right foot on the face and reach for a crimpy hold on the corner's arete.

otter_cliffs.name: Razorback
otter_cliffs.beta: Lower to ledge above the very bottom, easy climbing to a big step out right on a small chip. Stand up to a crimpy hold with the right hand and smear feet on the slab until you can reach the jugs.

otter_cliffs.name: Overhanging Corner
otter_cliffs.beta: Easy climbing to a good ledge, either head left on jugs or straight up the corner on hidden feet. Get feet in the crack for the crux, jam or pull on edges in the crack then find a right foot on the face and stem to the top.

cooksey_drive.name: Boulder Anchor
cooksey_drive.beta: Hardest move at the start, work feet out to the right and grab two low crimps to help stand up. Bump left foot high and reach for the jug straight ahead, walk up the rest of the route.

cooksey_drive.name: No Trespassing
cooksey_drive.beta: Easy start. At first big ledge, can go left up the face on high feet (harder) or go right onto the arete. Right version has reachy move for a right handhold, then huge right foot to stand on. For the final roof, get a high left and higher right handhold, smear feet and bump left hand over the edge to jugs.

cooksey_drive.name: Cooksey Arete
cooksey_drive.beta: Honestly have no memory of this climb but I don't think it was very hard.

cooksey_drive.name: Karate Chop
cooksey_drive.pic_txt: to the right of the arete
cooksey_drive.anchor_txt: Same placements as for arete, either get a huge quad or just re equalize
cooksey_drive.beta: High feet and decent but powerful hands the whole way, karate chop move midway up with left hand into the undercling/jam.

ocean_drive.name: Calvin's Corner
ocean_drive.anchor_txt: quad and hand sized pieces in the giant boulder/ledge on top of the cliff
ocean_drive.beta: Start is usually wet and slimy, but still goes with one 10a-ish move to a good ledge and stance. 5.7+ climbing the rest of the route on good laybacks and stemming positions.

ocean_drive.name: Weird anchor
ocean_drive.anchor_txt: 0.75 and 0.5 in the crack parallel to the edge of the cliff, tether yourself and step down to belay ledge. Other leg of the anchor is a bomber #1 in the eye level crack on the climber's right.

ocean_drive.name: Chimneyish
ocean_drive.anchor_txt: Thin hands to fists in the shallow crack back a ways from the edge, quad anchor works well here

canyon_cliffs.name: Baby Steps Left
canyon_cliffs.pic_txt: Start on the diagonal crack of Baby Steps, follow the crack to the top.
canyon_cliffs.beta: Just look for the holds man

canyon_cliffs.name: Night Soil
canyon_cliffs.beta: Handholds at the start aren't great, walk feet up + reach jugs about halfway up

canyon_cliffs.name: Easier Corner
canyon_cliffs.pic_txt: Corner/crack to the right of Night Soil

south_wall.name: Mme Lebois' Troubled Lunge
south_wall.pic_txt: Start on the rock bench 15ft right of Recollections of Pacifica, under a mini roof.
south_wall.anchor_txt: Gear anchor on the ledge to the left of the rap rings, #1-3 in the bigger crack and can back it up with a 0.4-0.5 above it.  Directional BD 0.75 / WC 0.5 above the start.
south_wall.beta: Pull the mini roof and step up, make the lunge left after a bit to stay near the arete. Eventually step all the way left past From Russia and continue up the arete on slabby feet.

south_wall.name: Wafer Step
south_wall.anchor_txt: Bolts / quad anchor, directional thin hands/fat fingers in the flake over the start.
south_wall.beta: Up and slightly right, then bear left on the glorious flake layback jug thing

south_wall.name: Jungle Book
south_wall.pic_txt: To the right of Wafer Step
south_wall.anchor_txt: #4 + #3 in the vertical crack, 0.4+0.5 in the smaller horizontal to the left. Directional on the right side opens up Mogley as well
south_wall.beta: Up through the ledges, mild stemming can help at parts but is by no means required

south_wall.name: Mogley
south_wall.pic_txt: To the right of Jungle Book
south_wall.anchor_txt: Same anchor as Jungle Book, use a directional 0.5 above the start about halfway up the route
south_wall.beta: Go up on jugs, unclip directional and step across left to finish
